headline: Uber Stock Slides as FTC Sues, Alleging 'Deceptive' Uber One Practices
summary: Uber shares fell Monday as the Federal Trade Commission filed a lawsuit alleging “deceptive billing and cancellation practices" related to the company's Uber One subscription service.

raw.headline: Uber Stock Slides as FTC Sues, Alleging 'Deceptive' Uber One Practices
raw.summary: Uber shares fell Monday as the Federal Trade Commission filed a lawsuit alleging “deceptive billing and cancellation practices" related to the company's Uber One subscription service.

headline: FTC sues Uber, alleging it signed up Uber One subscribers without their permission
summary: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission filed a lawsuit against Uber on Monday, alleging that it enrolled consumers in its Uber One subscription program without their consent and made it too difficult for them to cancel the service.  Uber One members pay $9.99 per month or $96 per year for a range of services, including fee-free Uber Eats food deliveries and cash back when they take Uber rides.  In its lawsuit, the FTC said multiple customers complained that Uber signed them up for Uber One without their permission or charged them for the service before a free trial period was over.

In its lawsuit, the FTC said multiple customers complained that Uber signed them up for Uber One without their permission or charged them for the service before a free trial period was over.

headline: Amazon, Salesforce, Uber: Trending tickers
summary: Here are some stocks on the move on Monday, April 21. Shares of Amazon (AMZN) are slipping. Raymond James downgraded its rating on the stock to Outperform from Strong Buy. Salesforce (CRM) shares were downgraded to Underperform by DA Davidson, while Guggenheim upgraded the stock to Neutral. The Federal Trade Commission has sued Uber (UBER) accusing the company of deceptive billing practices in relation to its Uber One service. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Why Uber Stock Was Down Today
summary: Shares of ride-hailing and delivery leader Uber (NYSE: UBER) were initially doing much better than the plunging stock market today, with only moderate declines as of midday.  Midday, news came over the wires that the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) was suing the company over tactics for signing up users to its Uber One subscription service.  Did Uber flout the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act?

headline: FTC accuses Uber of misleading subscribers
summary: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission on Monday sued Uber Technologies, accusing it of signing up some Uber One subscribers without their knowledge and making deceptive claims about the service.  The service costs $9.99 a month and offers discounts on fees associated with Uber's ride-hailing and food-delivery apps.  Uber falsely claimed that users would save about $25 a month through the service and deceived them about how easy it was to cancel, the FTC said in the lawsuit filed in San Francisco.

raw.headline: FTC accuses Uber of misleading subscribers

Uber falsely claimed that users would save about $25 a month through the service and deceived them about how easy it was to cancel, the FTC said in the lawsuit filed in San Francisco.
